antichess
Class TextAIPlayer

java.lang.Object
  antichess.TextAIPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
GamePlayer<ChessMove>, TextGamePlayer
public class TextAIPlayer
extends Object
implements TextGamePlayer

TextAIPlayer is an AIPlayer for use with the TextUI. The primary difference between the TextAIPlayer and the AIPlayer is that the TextAIPlayer only reports moves to the GameController after the TextUI has told it to report the moves.

Author:
nlharr
Specification Fields
  • clock //GameClock that store the timer for this TextAIPlayer
  • playerType //Player of this TextAIPlayer
  • currentMove //ChessMove that the TextAIPlayer is caching that the controller can access
  • possibleMove //ChessMove that the TextAIPlayer is caching that the controller can't access
  • controller //GameController

automaticallyTimed

public boolean automaticallyTimed()
Tells the controller that the TextAIPlayer handles it's own time

Specified by:
automaticallyTimed in interface GamePlayer<ChessMove>
Returns:
if the time for this player is handled automatically by the GameController

getMove

public ChessMove getMove(GameController controller)
Description copied from interface: GamePlayer
Asks the player for a move, if the player has a move the move is returned, if the player doesn't, null is returned immediately Once this GamePlayer is able to return a valid move it calls notifyControllerHasMove() on the controller.

Specified by:
getMove in interface GamePlayer<ChessMove>
See Also:
GamePlayer

gameEnded

public void gameEnded()
Description copied from interface: GamePlayer
Informs the player that this game is over, and it will not be asked for any more moves. This could happen for a number of reasons, including one player winning, or a human user cancelling the game.

Specified by:
gameEnded in interface GamePlayer<ChessMove>

getPossibleMove

public void getPossibleMove()
Description copied from interface: TextGamePlayer
Asks the TextGamePlayer to set a possible move if it can. A TextPlayer is unable to set a move A TextAIPlayer is able to

Specified by:
getPossibleMove in interface TextGamePlayer
Requires:
the TextAIPlayer have an available move
Effects:
sets possibleMove to a legal Antichess move determined by the AI and then prints this move in the specified format to stdout
Modifies:
possibleMove

doPossibleMove

public boolean doPossibleMove()
Description copied from interface: TextGamePlayer
Asks the TextGamePlayer to do the move returned by getPossibleMove If not move is returned by getPossibleMove no move is performed

Specified by:
doPossibleMove in interface TextGamePlayer
Returns:
true iff possibleMove != null
Effects:
if possibleMove != null currentMove = possibleMove, possibleMove = null calls controller.notifyControllerHasMove else prints First GetNextMove to stdout
Modifies:
possibleMove, currentMove

doMove

public boolean doMove(String moveString,
                      long time)
Description copied from interface: TextGamePlayer
Asks the TextGamePlayer to do a move described by moveString that takes time milliseconds. If this TextGamePlayer is a 'human' player ie TextPlayer then it will set currentMove to the move described by move string, if the move is illegal it will output "Illegal move".

Specified by:
doMove in interface TextGamePlayer
Returns:
false
